name: Crowne Plaza Los Angeles International Airport Hotel

reviews.text: we gave up our seats and had to fly out of LAX a day later so Delta put us up at the Crowne Plaza. The shuttles come every 10 mins, the hotel was under construction but was still very clean. The rooms were updated and very comfortable. I got a great night sleep. You can hear the airplanes from the airport, but they sound far off and oddly soothing. This is a great hotel and a very convenient location if you are traveling. The restaurant also has a great breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Flight delayed, but at least we got a good night sleep.

reviews.text: This hotel is very near the airport and the rooms are spacious, clean, and inviting. The staff was very helpful and there's a restaurant as well.
reviews.title: Good for a night
Great manager
reviews.text: The hotel, like many LA airport hotels, is massive. It features a 24/7 shuttle too.

The hotel was undergoing renovation so my stay was rather loud. There's a note in the hotel from the manager saying the work would be during the day to minimize disturbances but I sure wish that note were on the website and disclosed to all the places where people book rooms since my stay was from early morning to early evening - no overnight. (I had a long layover after a 12 hour flight from SE Asia).
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: I waited far too long for the shuttle at the airport - close to 30 minutes. I had to call the hotel before it came.
reviews.title: Good Overnight Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights and reserved the hotel via Hotwire. Got a 'can't beat it' rate.
reviews.title: Good hotel that's lacking in technology

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Pre Cruise

reviews.text: -Location worked well as I had business in Pasadena and Long Beach.
reviews.title: Tired and tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Rooms were clean and well-equipped.
reviews.title: Great place to stay before a flight out of LAX

reviews.text: -The Budget Car Rental facility was 1 block away. Saved at least one day of rental by having such easy access.
reviews.title: Paperwork not in order

reviews.text: I recently chose to stay at the Crowne Plaza, after a short holiday with friends the hotel is in a convenient location which after a long flight was exactly what I needed. On arrival & throughout my brief stay the staff were friendly & attentive which was a refreshing change. The room which I stayed was spacious, clean & comfortable. The food was also reasonably priced with a good selection, I would have no problem with recommending this hotel to others.
reviews.title: "Convenient & accommodating"

reviews.text: I had a mixup when I booked the hotel, somehow the dates were mixed up and after I drove 300 miles I arrived to find my reservation didn't start until 3 days later! Well the manager Davon with no small amount of effort got the booking company to cancel and refund the incorrect reservation, then booked me in for the correct dates thus saving me a long drive home or the loss of a substantial amount of money$$$!
reviews.title: Good looking out!

reviews.text: He saved my Weekend!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay while traveling in/out of LAX! VERY CLEAN!
Ok
reviews.text: Thanks Davon!

The Crown has everything you need to make your stay very comfortable. There is a casual eating area in the lobby where you can indulge many sides of what is needed for a meal there or take out for travel or up to your room (yummy sweets, sushi, pizza, sandwiches, other hot cooked items including breakfast.) They also have a small computer area with a printer to print out boarding passes. Well planned. The room was very clean, comfortable and overlooked the airport. My family loved watching the planes land and take off. There was no noise from aircraft. The service staff was great...very eager to be of help and very professional. There is an excellent shuttle service to the airport and to other parts of the city. I highly recommend this hotel. Check the internet for great "special" prices.
reviews.title: L.A. Airport Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 8 hours to clean up and have a sleep before a long flight. The room was nice, the shuttle worked fine, although some people found the wait a bit much. They were redoing the flooring by the elevators, so we used the service elevators and had to carry our own bags down the last floor to the exit. Not too big a hardship, but after being charged for Internet access I was pretty angry. This is 2012. It is even free at LAX! It is provided at Courtyards and most hotels I use. This chain needs to shape up.
reviews.title: OK stop for a few hours

reviews.text: I spent a night on the way to Las Vegas. This hotel offers a free shuttle from the airport and takes about 10 minutes (depending on traffic, I visited on Thanksgiving weekend, which meant enormous traffic jams). The room is huge, very clean and quite, although I did request a room away from the airport side (could still hear the planes but it wasn't noisy). it was also a newly renovated room, and the bed was very comfortable, good pillows too. The bathroom was very clean with toiletries provided and I have no complaints at all. There was extensive renovation work being done in the hotel lobby, with a partition off to one side of the reception desk being off-limits to the guests, also the lift well was being re-tiled and it was a little dusty downstairs, but this didn't affect my stay at all. There was a pizza bar downstairs where I had a delicious pizza, didn't try the restaurant but it looked standard fare and there was also a bar for cocktails etc. I see from other reviewers that reception staff were off-hand. I didn't get poor service from anyone and can happily recommend this hotel. There are many hotels along the same road, all chain hotels of a similar standard, but I was there for one night only and would stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

reviews.text: 4 of us stayed there after a flight from Mexico - only had to wait about 5 min. for the shuttle which was a nice surprise. Check in and out very quick and friendly. We had booked rooms on the 16th floor which had a lounge for people on that floor and had a couple of glasses of wine and some finger food. Beds soft and comfy and a great breakfast included. Will definetly stay there again when we are overnight in LA.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I would strongly recommend to stay away from this hotel even if offered a free room (which is what happened to me). Extremely arrrogant and obnoxious front desk staff after waiting in the line for over 15 minutes. They lack tremendous customer service and total care for the customer.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY EVEN FOR FREE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently had a early morning flight and decided it best to spend the night in Los Angeles. Crown Plaza was the best deal. The hotel is conveniently located within a few miles of the airport and they have shuttles running 24 hours a day back and forth. Besides that included in my cost of the room, I was able to leave my car in their parking lot for 7 days at no additional charge. The cost to and from the airport from Orange County would have costed me more.
reviews.title: Convenient and a great deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a stopover on oyr way to Sydney. The hotel is very close to the LAX Airport. The room was large enough to hold our bags. The bed was very comfortable and we had good rest before taking the long flight from lax to Sydney. We went to eat at In-N-Out which is about 10 minutes walking distance on Sepulveda Blvd since we always eat here on any visit to California. There are some sports bar on Sepulveda where you can play Pool, etc. But if you have some extra time visit the shopping malls in Los Angeles. You can even rent a car but remember you will have to pay for parking at the hotel. Overall the room was very comfortable and the shower had all the extras.
reviews.title: Good Stopover Hotel
Nice refurbished room
reviews.text: We stayed here twice in the last couple of weeks. Firstly a night in December after flying in from London and needing a night's accommodation before boarding a cruise, then after the cruise, we stayed here four nights over New Year-not by choice, our travel agent was struggling to get us in anywhere else on the dates we needed and for the price we wanted to pay.

We were in a nice, spacious room both times which had clearly been refurbished to a good standard and was very clean. The chambermaids/housekeeping staff were very good, friendly and thorough. We also had good service from the front desk for the most part and the concierge was helpful when we wanted some advice on getting around and a tour. The location isn't great if you want to do LA but is fine as an airport hotel and we enjoyed getting the $5 trolley bus to Manhattan Beach to eat somewhere other than the hotel or the others in the area.
reviews.title: Wait until they update Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We both sucked in our teeth when we discovered the wifi charges - thirty something dollars for 3 days, which was at least a small discount on the per diem charge. Even so, it meant my husband was online all the time as he was determined to try to get his money's worth!
reviews.title: FULLY RENOVATED

reviews.text: They appear to be in some kind of hotel update with lots of dust and dirt in hallways and construction on the 9th floor. Their fitness center is closed and the limited menu should be skipped. (I would rather walk back to the LXt Food Court, I am sure I would have received better, friendlier service there). Also had problems with room key not working and was provided wrong PIN for Priority Club Gold internet access; those things happen I understand but the rudeness and unapologetic staff is a real turnoff. I travel on average 4 days a week and do not have extremely high expectations for Crown Plaza's but this is probably the worst I have stayed at. One of 4 elevators out of service; fitness center closed; problems with Wi-fi; poor food service; rude front desk. Tomorrow I am checking in next door at the Sheraton Gateway.
reviews.title: MUCH BETTER

reviews.text: This past Wednesday I booked a room for a weekend - Thursday through Sunday - later discovered that I was able to stay at the USO for free; I walked in early Thursday morning to cancel my reservation. As I explained to the clerk my situation, she informed me that the person who took my order actually booked me for Wednesday through Sunday, and that because of policy I would have to pay for Wednesday as I canceled the rest of the reservation. That wasn't okay with Ralph Spates and Brianna. They both provided me with customer service and enthusiasm I have never seen from a hotel service lobby. In short, the cancelation was taken care of free of charge. I'm so happy that I ran into these two great people. I'm going to recommend the Crowne Plaza to everyone I meet.
reviews.title: Great Problem Solvers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park and Fly rate is only available through direct on - line bookings to their site. Do not boom though Travelocity, as their rate does not include park and fly. If you don't need parking, book with AAA discount for the best rate. Other park and fly sites that list this hotel, merely jack up the room rate to cover the 18.00. Per day rate. Free shuttle bus and park and fly give you the best value for a 4star hotel literally next door to the airport. It's quiet and clean. Large rooms and good food.
reviews.title: Best value if you are leaving your car at the airport

reviews.text: First impressions count, so count this one out. Although one of the newest airport hotels in LA airport area, and equated to Hilton and Hyatt, this hotel just doesn't match the others' grade. Uninviting, indeed, dangerous location means little chance to walk outside to explore any outside dining options such as Carls Jr, Denny's, Subway, and other culinary chain delights. This place is more like an uninviting high rise motel. Guest amenities include laundry and the standard ice station. Clean rooms begin with a hospital-sterility entry and bathroom, although the bedroom fit out raises the bar a bit. The pull out desk cum table is neat, but crinkly bedspread cover more attuned to hospital washing over tactile comfort-- ditto the polystyrene-like bed bolster. Pillows soft and comfy, mattress firm with soft overlay, so no complaints there -- but we recall SF Crowne Plaza as positively wonderful sleeping, not in the same standard here at all. Lobby cold and informal, with curt check in staff and a confusing registration line with no signage that leaves clients embarrassed when they invariably crowd the queue -- there were four people innocently cutting in front of others when we checked in because of the confusion. And the counter staff just glared, but gave no assistance whatsoever. Thoughtfully, the hotel has two floors designated "Quiet Zone" -- although check in did not even let me know I was upgraded! Stated policy is a promise of no noisy room cleaning, no children, and "and no farm animals" joked the duty manager -- so I was amazed to see a cleaning trolley outside my room at 9 am and hear hall vacuuming at 9:30.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: I recently stayed for one night at the Crowne Plaza Los Angeles right near LAX airport. I had a VERY late arrival and chose this airport due to its close proximity to LAX airport, which is really great. The parking garage for the hotel is not free, and late at night can feel a little sketchy. The hotel does offer a valet service for more money if you'd prefer.
reviews.title: I did not have a good stay (But I have a feeling this was a fluke)

reviews.text: The rooms at this hotel are very nicely decorated, and feature many of the typical Crowne Plaza features. The beds are clean and comfortable and the TV was large and had a good selection of channels.
reviews.title: Nice & Modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel at either end of a trip to Hawaii to break up the trip from/to the UK. Caught the free shuttle from outside of LAX, journey time about 15mins max but longer on the return trip to the airport. Large reception area with nice & easy smooth check in. There is a small outdoor pool area on the 2nd floor. Big friendly bar serving food with multiple TVs and also a separate restaurant & cafe with a small business area located close by.
reviews.title: Perfect for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Breakfast offers a buffet or individually cooked meals - our waiter advised on getting the buffet as what we had chosen worked out more expensive than the buffet but was all available individually on there - thank you!
reviews.title: Easy walking but room dusty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area has a real time map showing where the shuttle buses are in location to the hotel so you have an idea of how long your wait will be.
reviews.title: Stay Here for comfort and rest.

reviews.text: Overall we were suitably impressed with the hotel and would have no qualms in using it again.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.text: Hotel is within an easy walk of the airport which was fantastic after a 12 hour flight. Check-in was easy and quick. Got a room with a view of arriving aircraft at the back of the hotel. Check out was also quick and easy.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay..

reviews.text: Stayed here night before an early flight from LAX. The bellman was nice, fast and easy check-in and room was very nice. Shuttle was quick and easy and was already waiting when we went down (at 5 AM) and hotel is very short ride away (airport entrance is literally next to hotel).
reviews.title: Nice airport hotel but loud in room

reviews.text: The only negative was that I thought our room was loud. We were near a runway so you could hear the jet engines rev up right before take-off. However, I always travel with earplugs and a white noise app on my phone so it didn't really bother me. Since jets take off until late you should ask for a quieter room (we were 1218) or be sure to bring earplugs.
reviews.title: well worth it

reviews.text: I even got a voucher for a free drink but the coffee shop wasn't open yet at 5 AM so did not get a chance to use it.
reviews.title: Much better after refurbishment good value

reviews.text: Very close to the airport, just 7 minutes by their shuttle. Check in was fast and cordial. Rooms are a good size, well appointed with decent sized bathrooms. I expected the internet would be free - like other hotels close by - but it is $14.95 for 24 hours. I ordered room service and had two pleasant surprises: first that it came in 15 minutes instead of the 40 they promised, and second that it was more food than I could handle (and that is saying something trust me).
reviews.title: I'm going going back back to .....Crown Plaza LAX....
Do not stay there, there are plenty of better options out there
reviews.text: Location is also good for shopping if you are not driving - a short walk to the bus station where you can take the bus to Culver City and the Westfield Mall.

description: Welcome to the newly renovated Crowne Plaza Hotel - Los Angeles International Airport (LAX)! Our 613 room, full- service hotel is the gateway to Los Angeles. Located less than one mile from the LAX terminals, with 24-hour complimentary shuttle service to and from LAX! While only steps away from LAX, the Crowne Plaza Hotel- Los Angeles International Airport is convenient to all major southern California area attractions, including Hollywood, Disneyland, Universal Studios and The Los Angeles Convention Center. Immediate access to the I-405 and I-105 freeways and the beach communities of Marina Del Rey, Santa Monica, Venice Beach, Manhattan Beach and Redondo Beach are just minutes away! Also, the shopping and business districts of El Segundo, Culver City and Westchester are all within 3 miles!The Crowne Plaza - Los Angeles International Airport has 14,000 sq feet of flexible space, with an emphasis on service and convenience. Our experienced Crowne Meetings Director and Certified Wedding Consultant hold the highest recognition of Certified Meeting Professional, CMP, and will ensure your meeting, social event or wedding is a complete success. After a long day of business meetings or sight seeing you will enjoy our Sleep Advantage program, which includes premium bedding, sleep amenities, guaranteed wake- up calls and designated quiet zones!Come stay and play with us in Los Angeles!
